description.narrative: Output 4: By 2018, National and county governments and partners have capacity for adequate preparedness and coordinated response to emergency and children affected by conflict, to access quality lifesaving and peace building education in line with Core Commitment for Children

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
HSS - Risk informed programming including climate resilience disaster and conflict
Provision of skills development for multiple age groups (including in temporary learning spaces)
Relief co-ordination, protection and support services
System strengthening - risk informed programming, including climate, resilience, disaster, conflict, and emergency preparedness

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities emergency relief

Kenya Country Programme Document 7/2014-6/2018 Results Matrix
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
"2018 Kenya: Real Time Evaluation on Emergency Drought Situation Response in Kenya 2017"
Kenya 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 4: By 2018, National and county governments and partners have capacity for adequate preparedness and coordinated response to emergency and children affected by conflict, to access quality lifesaving and peace building education in line with Core Commitment for Children

description.narrative: 98,901 (40 percent girls) learners affected by conflict and crises had access to quality primary education, because of UNICEF financial support. UNICEF supported construction of 3 new schools with 46 temporary classrooms, 49 gender-sensitive latrines and 3 water storage tanks in Kalobeyei benefiting 5,448 children (2,382 girls). | Status:Partially Met | As-of Date:30/06/2018

title.narrative: No of girls and boys with increased knowledge on DRR
No of boys and girls affected by emergencies and conflict benefitting from provision of emergency supplies, life skill training, peace education.
No of Alternative Learning space in refugee camp and host community
No of counties with emergency and DRR response plans
Child sensitive national risk management plans that address risks related to education in emergencies are in place
Education systems are implementing a minimum package of interventions to promote learning outcomes including early learning
